subSections.title: Etymology
subSections.text:
From {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*maŋ||big; old; elder (brother, uncle)}} ({{zh-ref|Sagart, 1999}}; STEDT). Related to {{och-l|孟|great; eldest brother; first}}; see there for more.

{{zh-ref|Schuessler (2007)}}, instead, connects it to Proto-Lolo-Burmese {{m|und|*ʔwyik||elder sibling}}, which is from {{der|zh|sit-pro|*ʔik||elder brother}}.

Alternatively, {{zh-ref|Benedict (1972)}} relates it to {{inh|zh|sit-pro|*bʷaŋ ~ *pʷaŋ||(paternal) uncle; elder brother}}, which is possibly also related to {{och-l|伯|paternal uncle; eldest brother}}.
